 50template <typename T>
 51inline T 
 52bnot(T t) VSIP_NOTHROW { return ~t;}

 54using std::ceil;

 59/// Some general comments.
 60///
 61/// :Returns:
 62///   The complex number corresponding to the angle of a unit vector in the
 63///   complex plane, i.e., exp(j * x) for argument x .
 64template <typename T>
 65inline std::complex<T>
 66euler (T x) VSIP_NOTHROW { return std::polar(T (1), x);}
 67
 68using std::log;
 69using std::log10;
 70
 71using std::exp;
 72
 73#if HAVE_DECL_EXP10
 74// If the C++ library provides ::exp10 (as an extension to ISO C++),
 75// we can use it.
 76using ::exp10;
 77#else // !HAVE_DECL_EXP10
 78// If the C++ library does not provide ::exp10 we have to provide our
 79// own version.
 80inline double 
 81exp10(double d) VSIP_NOTHROW {
 82  return exp(d * log(10.0));
 83}
 84#endif // !HAVE_DECL_EXP10
 85
 86// Provide an overloaded version of exp10 that accepts a "float".
 87inline float
 88exp10(float f) VSIP_NOTHROW {
 89#if HAVE_DECL_EXP10F
 90  return exp10f (f);
 91#else // !HAVE_DECL_EXP10F
 92  return (float) exp10((double) f);
 93#endif // !HAVE_DECL_EXP10F
 94}
 95
 96// Provide an overloaded version of exp10 that accepts a "long
 97// double".
 98inline long double
 99exp10(long double ld) VSIP_NOTHROW {
100#if HAVE_DECL_EXP10L
101  return exp10l (ld);
102#else // !HAVE_DECL_EXP10L
103  // ISO C++ requires that there an overload form of "exp" that 
104  // takes a "long double" argument.  
105  return exp(ld * log(10.0l));
106#endif // !HAVE_DECL_EXP10L
107}
108
109template <typename T1,
110	  typename T2,
111	  typename T3>
112inline typename Promotion<T1, typename Promotion<T2, T3>::type>::type
113expoavg (T1 a,
114	 T2 b,
115	 T3 c) VSIP_NOTHROW
116{
117  return a * b + (T1(1) - a) * c;
118}

120using std::floor;
121using std::imag;
122
123template <typename T>
124inline T 
125ite(bool pred, T a, T b) VSIP_NOTHROW { return pred ? a : b;}
126
127// isfinite, isnan, and isnormal are macros provided by C99 <math.h>
128// They are not part of C++ <cmath>.
129//
130// GCC's cmath captures them, removing the macros, and providing
131// functions std::isfinite, std::isnan, and std::isnormal.
132//
133// GreenHills on MCOE only provides macros.
134//
135// 070502: MCOE GCC 3.4.4 does not capture them.
136
137// Pull isfinite, isnan, and isnormal into fn namespace so Fp_traits
138// can see them.
139#if HAVE_STD_ISFINITE
140using std::isfinite;
141#endif
142#if HAVE_STD_ISNAN
143using std::isnan;
144#endif
145#if HAVE_STD_ISNORMAL
146using std::isnormal;
147#endif
148
149template <typename T>
150struct Fp_traits
151{
152  static bool is_finite(T val)
153  {
154#ifdef  _MSC_VER
155    return _isfinite(val); 
156#else
157    return isfinite(val); 
158#endif
159  }
160  static bool is_nan(T val)    
161  {
162#ifdef  _MSC_VER
163    return _isnan(val);
164#else
165    return isnan(val);
166#endif
167  }
168  static bool is_normal(T val) { return isnormal(val); }
169};
170
171template <typename T>
172 struct Fp_traits<std::complex<T> >
173{
174  static bool is_finite(std::complex<T> const& val)
175  {
176#ifdef  _MSC_VER
177    return _isfinite(val.real()) && _isfinite(val.imag()); 
178#else
179    return isfinite(val.real()) && isfinite(val.imag()); 
180#endif
181  }
182
183  static bool is_nan(std::complex<T> const& val)    
184  {
185#ifdef  _MSC_VER
186    return _isnan(val.real()) || _isnan(val.imag()); 
187#else
188    return isnan(val.real()) || isnan(val.imag()); 
189#endif
190  }
191
192  static bool is_normal(std::complex<T> const& val) 
193  { return isnormal(val.real()) && isnormal(val.imag()); }
194};
195
196
197// is_finite -- returns nonzero/true if x is finite not plus or minus inf,
198//              and not NaN.
199
200template <typename T>
201inline bool is_finite(T val)
202{
203  return Fp_traits<T>::is_finite(val);
204}
205
206
207// is_nan -- returns nonzero/true if x is NaN.
208
209template <typename T>
210inline bool is_nan(T val)
211{
212  return Fp_traits<T>::is_nan(val);
213}
214
215
216// isnormal -- returns nonzero/true if x is finite and normalized. (C99).
217
218template <typename T>
219inline bool
220is_normal(T val)
221{
222  return Fp_traits<T>::is_normal(val);
223}
224
225
226
227template <typename T>
228inline T 
229lnot(T t) VSIP_NOTHROW { return !t;}

231namespace abs_detail
232{
233
234// GreenHills <cmath> defines ::abs(float) and ::abs(double), but does
235// not place them into the std namespace when targeting mercury (when
236// _MC_EXEC is defined).
237
238#if VSIP_IMPL_FIX_MISSING_ABS
239using ::abs;
240#endif
241using std::abs;
242} // namespace abs_detail
243
244template <typename T>
245inline typename impl::Scalar_of<T>::type 
246mag(T t) VSIP_NOTHROW { return abs_detail::abs(t);}
247
248namespace magsq_detail
249{
250
251template <typename T, typename R>
252struct Magsq_impl_base
253{
254  static R exec(T val) { return val*val; }
255};
256
257template <typename T, typename R>
258struct Magsq_impl_base<std::complex<T>, R>
259{
260  static R exec(std::complex<T> const& val)
261  { return sq(val.real()) + sq(val.imag()); }
262};
263
264template <typename T>
265struct Magsq_impl : public Magsq_impl_base<T,T> {};
266
267template <typename T>
268struct Magsq_impl<std::complex<T> >
269{
270  static T exec(std::complex<T> const& val)
271  { return sq(val.real()) + sq(val.imag()); }
272};
273
274template <typename R>
275struct Magsq_impl_helper
276{
277  template <typename T>
278  struct Magsq_impl : public Magsq_impl_base<T,R> {};
279};
280
281} // namespace magsq_detail
282
283template <typename T>
284inline typename impl::Scalar_of<T>::type 
285magsq(T t) VSIP_NOTHROW 
286{
287  return magsq_detail::Magsq_impl<T>::exec(t);
288}
289
290template <typename T, typename ResultT>
291inline ResultT
292magsq(T t, ResultT) VSIP_NOTHROW 
293{
294  return magsq_detail::Magsq_impl_helper<ResultT>::template Magsq_impl<T>::exec(t);
295}

339template <typename T1, typename T2>
340inline bool
341ge(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return t1 >= t2;}

343template <typename T1, typename T2>
344inline bool
345gt(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return t1 > t2;}
346
347inline double
348hypot(double t1, double t2) VSIP_NOTHROW {
349#if HAVE_HYPOT
350  return ::hypot(t1, t2);
351#else
352  return sqrt(sq(t1) + sq(t2));
353#endif
354}
355
356inline float
357hypot(float t1, float t2) VSIP_NOTHROW 
358{
359#if HAVE_HYPOTF
360  return ::hypotf(t1, t2);
361#else
362  return hypot((double)t1, (double)t2);
363#endif
364}

366template <typename T1, typename T2>
367inline bool
368land(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return t1 && t2;}
369
370template <typename T1, typename T2>
371inline bool
372lor(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return t1 || t2;}
373
374template <typename T1, typename T2>
375inline bool
376lxor(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return (t1 && !t2) || (!t1 && t2);}
377
378inline cscalar_f
379jmul(cscalar_f t1, cscalar_f t2) VSIP_NOTHROW 
380{
381  cscalar_f retn(t1);
382  t1 *= conj(t2);
383  return t1;
384}

394using std::max;
395
396template <typename T1, typename T2>
397inline typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type
398impl_max(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return t1 > t2 ? t1 : t2; }

402maxmg(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return impl_max(mag(t1), mag(t2));}

406maxmgsq(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return impl_max(fn::magsq(t1), fn::magsq(t2));}

410template <typename T1, typename T2>
411inline typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type
412impl_min(T1 t1, T2 t2) VSIP_NOTHROW { return t1 < t2 ? t1 : t2; }

448template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>
449inline typename Promotion<typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type, T3>::type
450am(T1 t1, T2 t2, T3 t3) VSIP_NOTHROW { return (t1 + t2) * t3;}
451
452template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>
453inline typename Promotion<typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type, T3>::type
454ma(T1 t1, T2 t2, T3 t3) VSIP_NOTHROW { return t1 * t2 + t3;}
455
456template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>
457inline typename Promotion<typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type, T3>::type
458msb(T1 t1, T2 t2, T3 t3) VSIP_NOTHROW { return t1 * t2 - t3;}
459
460template <typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>
461inline typename Promotion<typename Promotion<T1, T2>::type, T3>::type
462sbm(T1 t1, T2 t2, T3 t3) VSIP_NOTHROW { return (t1 - t2) * t3;}
463
464template <typename T>
465struct Impl_complex_class
466{
467  static T conj(T val) { return val; }
468  static T real(T val) { return val; }
469  static T imag(T val) { return T(); }
470};
471
472template <typename T>
473struct Impl_complex_class<std::complex<T> >
474{
475  static std::complex<T> conj(std::complex<T> val) { return std::conj(val); }
476  static T real(std::complex<T> val) { return val.real(); }
477  static T imag(std::complex<T> val) { return val.imag(); }
478};
479
480template <typename T>
481inline T
482impl_conj(T val) { return Impl_complex_class<T>::conj(val); }
483
484template <typename T>
485inline typename impl::Scalar_of<T>::type
486impl_real(T val) { return Impl_complex_class<T>::real(val); }
487
488template <typename T>
489inline typename impl::Scalar_of<T>::type
490impl_imag(T val) { return Impl_complex_class<T>::imag(val); }
491
